intro: Rubus zobothicus, commonly known as the European blackberry shrub, is a species of bramble native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodlands and along hedgerows. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and horticultural purposes.
